unit_learning_outcomes.description: Review and critique existing corporate law and regulatory strategies domestically and internationally
Understand and convey key concepts related to corporate governance and corporate regulation.
Examine alternative corporate law and regulatory models and assess their application
Describe and analyse the context in which corporate governance policies and practices operate

enrolment_rules.description: (80cp in LAW or LAWS units) or (130cp including (MMCC2014 or MAS214) or (BUSL250 and BUSL301) or (BUSL251 or ACCG2051)

assessments.description: A series of online engagement activities and zoom tutorial discussion
A research essay exploring an important aspect of modern corporate governance
Multiple choice quizzes assessing key concepts

data.description: What exactly is a corporation? Who's interests do corporations serve? How should corporations be held responsible for social or environmental harms? These are just some of the questions this course addresses. Corporations are powerful and complex legal creations with immense influence over society, economy, politics and environment. In this advanced unit, students will build on existing knowledge of business organisations and corporate law to gain deeper insight into how corporations govern themselves and how they are regulated by external actors, both in Australia and internationally. Students will engage in research and critical analysis of existing corporate governance strategies and the laws that govern corporate interactions, advancing their understanding of the actors and organisations that impact corporate governance, including: corporate boards, corporate regulators, auditors and stock exchanges. This course provides an opportunity to explore concepts such as Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR), Environmental and Social Governance (ESG), and Business and Human Rights. Students will analyse the relationships and legal obligations between corporations and their shareholders, creditors, employees and customers.
data.title: Modern Corporate Governance
